wesm commented on pull request #6432: ARROW-7863: [C++][Python][CI] Ensure running HDFS related tests
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6432#discussion_r380140432
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .env
 ##########
 @@ -35,6 +35,7 @@ PANDAS=latest
 DASK=latest
 TURBODBC=latest
 HDFS=2.9.2
+LIBHDFS3=2.3
 
 Review comment:
   libhdfs3 2.3 is not supported at all. Version 2.2.31 is the last one we support but I'm not sure if that still works with the current set of conda-forge dependencies / compilers. We might propose reverting the feedstock to the last "good" version that uses the libhdfs C ABI
   
   https://github.com/conda-forge/libhdfs3-feedstock/commit/97fd9320efd5cbac0145db60c9b867582e9a748a#diff-ae18fe4e01e61a9862ceaf165003213a

pitrou commented on pull request #6432: ARROW-7863: [C++][Python][CI] Ensure running HDFS related tests
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6432#discussion_r380209436
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/scripts/integration_hdfs.sh
 ##########
 @@ -22,20 +22,57 @@ set -e
 source_dir=${1}/cpp
 build_dir=${2}/cpp
 
-export CLASSPATH=`$HADOOP_HOME/bin/hadoop classpath --glob`
+export CLASSPATH=$($HADOOP_HOME/bin/hadoop classpath --glob)
 export HADOOP_CONF_DIR=$HADOOP_HOME/etc/hadoop
 export LIBHDFS3_CONF=$HADOOP_CONF_DIR/hdfs-site.xml
-export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:$HADOOP_HOME/lib/native/
+export ARROW_LIBHDFS3_DIR=$CONDA_PREFIX/lib
+
+libhdfs_dir=$HADOOP_HOME/lib/native
+hadoop_home=$HADOOP_HOME
+
+function use_hadoop_home() {
+  unset ARROW_LIBHDFS_DIR
+  export HADOOP_HOME=$hadoop_home
+}
+
+function use_libhdfs_dir() {
+  unset HADOOP_HOME
+  export ARROW_LIBHDFS_DIR=$libhdfs_dir
+}
 
 Review comment:
   @kou Could you explain the difference between the two? (use_hadoop_home vs. use_libhdfs_dir)
   Are there two sources for libhdfs?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on pull request #6432: ARROW-7863: [C++][Python][CI] Ensure running HDFS related tests
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6432#discussion_r380429174
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/scripts/integration_hdfs.sh
 ##########
 @@ -22,20 +22,57 @@ set -e
 source_dir=${1}/cpp
 build_dir=${2}/cpp
 
-export CLASSPATH=`$HADOOP_HOME/bin/hadoop classpath --glob`
+export CLASSPATH=$($HADOOP_HOME/bin/hadoop classpath --glob)
 export HADOOP_CONF_DIR=$HADOOP_HOME/etc/hadoop
 export LIBHDFS3_CONF=$HADOOP_CONF_DIR/hdfs-site.xml
-export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:$HADOOP_HOME/lib/native/
+export ARROW_LIBHDFS3_DIR=$CONDA_PREFIX/lib
+
+libhdfs_dir=$HADOOP_HOME/lib/native
+hadoop_home=$HADOOP_HOME
+
+function use_hadoop_home() {
+  unset ARROW_LIBHDFS_DIR
+  export HADOOP_HOME=$hadoop_home
+}
+
+function use_libhdfs_dir() {
+  unset HADOOP_HOME
+  export ARROW_LIBHDFS_DIR=$libhdfs_dir
+}
 
 Review comment:
   We need to find `${HADOOP_HOME}/lib/native/libhdfs.so` when user uses `HADOOP_HOME`.
   We need to find `${ARROW_LIBHDFS_DIR}/libhdfs.so` when user uses `ARROW_LIBHDFS_DIR`.
   
   If `HADOOP_HOME` is defined, `ARROW_LIBHDFS_DIR` isn't used. So we need to test them separately.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org
